messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] What's Missing on the S-A?
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry for the slackness in reply - I do have a suggestion but it must wait - however, I ve just come across this in an unrelated trawl that may be of iterest:
messages.messageBody:
Sorry for the slackness in reply - I do have a suggestion but it must wait - however, I've just come across this in an unrelated trawl that may be of iterest:
http://www.joelscoins.com/japan.htm

Regards,
Barry Thomas.

----- Original Message -----
From: Kitsuno
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, February 06, 2007 4:03 PM
Subject: [samuraihistory] What's Missing on the S-A?


We have around 1800 people here, so I was hoping to get some ideas -
Basically, as everyone knows the "SamuraiWiki" is dedicated to
anything and everything Japan prior to the 20th century, as well as
other history related things - so what sort of articles do YOU want to
see that isn't up there already?

I appreciate any feedback! And if anyone wants to WRITE something,
join the SamuraiWiki Editor's group, and let me know:

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/samuraiwiki/

.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: What's Missing on the S-A?
messages.msgSnippet: Sure can, I have seen a lot of material with patterns and pictures, but  when it comes to putting things together, I always encounter the problem of is this
messages.messageBody:
Sure can, I have seen a lot of material with patterns and pictures, but when
it comes to putting things together, I always encounter the problem of is
this thing folded over or under the obi, it is open all the way from the top to
the bottom, and so on. All I am saying that yes, I stink at sewing to begin
with (I am a guy)and is hard to look at patterns and pictures and try to put
something together, whether is a Yoroi, or a Hitatare or any of the other
fancy court garbs with out a "baby" steps guide..

Humbly,
Sukeie

To ask a question, may be a moments shame,
but not to ask and remain ignorant, is a life long shame.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
